intro: Dorstenia mannii, commonly known as the African mountain banana, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is known for its ability to thrive in rocky and disturbed habitats. Its fibrous roots and leaves have been traditionally used for their medicinal properties, including treating skin conditions and as a poultice for wounds.
